sen.j: 大伴手拍（おおとも の たうち、生年不明 - 和銅6年（713年）9月17日）は、日本の飛鳥時代から奈良時代にかけての貴族である。
sen.e: OTOMO no Tauchi (year of birth unknown and died on September 17, 713) was a man of noble ancestry from the Aska period to the Nara period in Japan.
OTOMO no Tauchi (year of birth unknown and died on September 17, 713) was an aristocrat in the Aska period and the Nara period in Japan.
sen.cmt: a man of noble ancestry →an aristocratto →the aska period and the Nara period
sen.e: OTOMO no Tauchi (year of birth unknown and died on September 17, 713) was an aristocrat in the Aska period and the Nara period in Japan.
His kabane (the hereditary title given by the Imperial Court) was Sukune.
His kabane (the hereditary title given by the Imperial Court) was Sukune.
His kabane (the hereditary title given by the Imperial Court) was Sukune.

sen.j: 名の読みは他に「てうち」、「てがしわ」がある。
sen.e: Other readings of his name were 'Teuchi' and 'Tegashiwa'.
Other readings of his name were 'Teuchi' and 'Tegashiwa'.
Other readings of his name were 'Teuchi' and 'Tegashiwa'.

sen.j: 有力な大伴氏の一員だが、系譜は不明。
sen.e: He belonged to the powerful clan, the Otomo clan, but his genealogy has remained unknown.
He belonged to the powerful clan, the Otomo clan, but his genealogy is unknown.
He belonged to the powerful clan, the Otomo clan, but his genealogy is unknown.

sen.j: 冠位は、造宮卿、従四位下。
sen.e: His official title was Zogukyo (the head of Zogusho, the Ministry where officials planed to construct or refurbish the Imperial Palace), Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
His official title was Zogukyo (the head of Zogusho, the Ministry where officials planned to construct or refurbish the Imperial Palace), Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
sen.cmt: planedは間違いなので修正しました。
sen.e: His official title was Zogukyo (the head of Zogusho, the Ministry where officials planned to construct or refurbish the Imperial Palace), Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade).
Achievement
Achievement
Achievement

sen.j: 手拍が史料に初めて見えるのは、『日本書紀』の持統天皇3年6月癸未（2日）条である。
sen.e: He was first described in the article of the Emperor Jito on June 2, 689 of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: He was first described in the article of the Emperor Jito on June 2, 689 of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).
He was first described in the article of the Emperor Jito on June 2, 689 of "Nihonshoki" (Chronicles of Japan).

sen.j: この日、志貴皇子、佐味宿那麻呂、羽田斉、伊余部馬飼、調老人、大伴手拍、巨勢多益須が撰善言司に任じられた。
sen.e: On that day, Prince Shiki, SAMI no Sukumaro, HANEDA Sei, IYOBE no Umakai, TSUKI no Okina, OTOMO no Taichi and KOSE no Tayasu were appointed to be Sen Zengen no Tsukasa (officials in charge of compiling instructive tales from Chinese classics and Japanese traditional literature with the aim of giving education to the Imperial family.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処 読み方不明のため、「羽田斉」を「HANEDA Sei」、「撰善言司」を「Sen Zengen no Tsukasa」としました
sen.e: On that day, Prince Shiki, SAMI no Sukumaro, HANEDA Sei, IYOBE no Umakai, TSUKI no Okina, OTOMO no Tauchi and KOSE no Tayasu were appointed to be Sen Zengen no Tsukasa (officials in charge of compiling instructive tales from Chinese classics and Japanese traditional literature with the aim of giving education to the Imperial family.

On that day, Prince Shiki, SAMI no Sukumaro, HANEDA Sei, IYOBE no Umakai, TSUKI no Okina, OTOMO no Tauchi and KOSE no Tayasu were appointed to be Sen Zengen no Tsukasa (officials in charge of compiling instructive tales from Chinese classics and Japanese traditional literature with the aim of giving education to the Imperial family.

sen.j: このとき大伴宿禰手拍の位は務大参で、この頃大伴氏の最高位は大伴御行であった。
sen.e: At that time, the official rank of OTOMO no Sukune Tauchi was Mui Daisan (the twenty-first grade of the forty-eight official ranks) and around this time, a person with the highest official rank of the OTOMO clan was OTOMO no Miyuki.
sen.cmt: 「務大参」の読み方不明のため Mui Daisan (the twenty-first grade of the fourty-eight official ranks) としました。
sen.e: At that time, the official rank of OTOMO no Sukune Tauchi was Mui Daisan (the twenty-first grade of the forty-eight official ranks) and around this time, a person with the highest official rank of the OTOMO clan was OTOMO no Miyuki.

At that time, the official rank of OTOMO no Sukune Tauchi was Mui Daisan (the twenty-first grade of the forty-eight official ranks) and around this time, a person with the highest official rank of the OTOMO clan was OTOMO no Miyuki.

sen.j: 文武天皇2年（698年）11月23日の大嘗祭のとき、物部氏の支族榎井倭麻呂が大楯を立て、大伴手拍が楯と桙を立てた。
sen.e: At the event of Daijo-sai festival (a festival to celebrate the enthronement of an emperor) on November 23, 698, ENOI no Ason Yamatomaro, a member of the branch family of the Monobe clan put up a giant shield and OTOMO no Tauchi put up a shield and a spear with four prongs.

At the event of Daijo-sai festival (a festival to celebrate the enthronement of an emperor) on November 23, 698, ENOI no Ason Yamatomaro, a member of the branch family of the Mononobe clan put up a giant shield and OTOMO no Tauchi put up a shield and a spear with four prongs.

At the event of Daijo-sai festival (a festival to celebrate the enthronement of an emperor) on November 23, 698, ENOI no Ason Yamatomaro, a member of the branch family of the Mononobe clan put up a giant shield and OTOMO no Tauchi put up a shield and a spear with four prongs.

sen.j: 古くからの軍事氏族である物部氏と大伴氏が大嘗宮の門の前で楯と鉾を立てるのは、大嘗祭の恒例であった。
sen.e: Putting up a shield and a spear with four prongs in front of the gate of Daijo-gu (a temporary shrine prepared at the Palace for Daijo-sai festival) by the established military clans, the Mononobe clan and the Otomo clan was atime-honored practice in Daijo-sai festival.

Putting up a shield and a spear with four prongs in front of the gate of Daijo-gu (a temporary shrine prepared at the Palace for Daijo-sai festival) by the established military clans, the Mononobe clan and the Otomo clan was a traditional practice in Daijo-sai festival.

Putting up a shield and a spear with four prongs in front of the gate of Daijo-gu (a temporary shrine prepared at the Palace for Daijo-sai festival) by the established military clans, the Mononobe clan and the Otomo clan was a traditional practice in Daijo-sai festival.

sen.j: このとき手拍の位は直広肆であった。
sen.e: At that time, Tauchi's official rank was Jiki Koshi (the twenty-eighth grade of the forty-eight official ranks).
sen.cmt: 「直広肆」の読み方不明のため「Jiki Koshi (the twenty-eight grade of the fourty-eight official ranks)」としました。
sen.e: At that time, Tauchi's official rank was Jiki Koshi (the twenty-eighth of the forty-eight official ranks).
At that time, Tauchi's official rank was Jiki Koshi (the twenty-eighth of the forty-eight official ranks).

sen.j: 御行が大宝元年（701年）に死ぬと、大伴氏の最高位の人物はその弟大伴安麻呂になり、手拍がそれに次いだ。
sen.e: After Miyuki died in 701, a person with the highest official rank of the Otomo clan was Miyuki's brother, OTOMO Yasumaro followed by Tauchi.
After Miyuki died in 701, a person with the highest official rank of the Otomo clan was Miyuki's brother, OTOMO no Yasumaro followed by Tauchi.
After Miyuki died in 701, a person with the highest official rank of the Otomo clan was Miyuki's brother, OTOMO no Yasumaro followed by Tauchi.

sen.j: 慶雲2年（705年）5月9日、正五位下の手柏は尾張守になった。
sen.e: On May 9, 705, Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Tekashiwa became Owari no Kami (the governor of Owari Province).
On May 9, 705, Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Tekashiwa became Owari no Kami (the governor of Owari Province).
On May 9, 705, Shogoinoge (Senior Fifth Rank, Lower Grade), Tekashiwa became Owari no Kami (the governor of Owari Province).

sen.j: 和銅元年（708年）3月13日に、正五位上で造宮卿になった。
sen.e: On March 13, 708, he rose to the official rank of Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) and became Zogukyo (the head of the Ministry where officials planed to construct and refurbish the Imperial Palace).

On March 13, 708, he rose to the official rank of Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) and became Zogukyo (the head of the Ministry where officials planned to construct and refurbish the Imperial Palace).

On March 13, 708, he rose to the official rank of Shogoinojo (Senior Fifth Rank, Upper Grade) and became Zogukyo (the head of the Ministry where officials planned to construct and refurbish the Imperial Palace).

sen.j: 平城京の造都を担う重職である。
sen.e: He took an important role of creating Heijokyo (the ancient capital of Japan in present-day Nara Prefecture).
It was an important role of creating Heijokyo (the ancient capital of Japan in present-day Nara Prefecture).
It was an important role of creating Heijokyo (the ancient capital of Japan in present-day Nara Prefecture).

sen.j: 和銅2年（709年）正月、正五位上から従四位下に昇った。
sen.e: On January 1, 709, he rose to the official rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) from Shogoinojo.
On January 1, 709, he was promoted to the official rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) from Shogoinojo.
On January 1, 709, he was promoted to the official rank of Jushiinoge (Junior Fourth Rank, Lower Grade) from Shogoinojo.

sen.j: 和銅6年（713年）9月17日に造宮卿、従四位下で死んだ。
sen.e: On September 17, 713, he died with the official rank of Zogukyo, Jushiinoge.
On September 17, 713, he died at the official rank of Zogukyo, Jushiinoge.
On September 17, 713, he died at the official rank of Zogukyo, Jushiinoge.
